question.long: Does stretching after sport prevent muscle soreness?

description: Results from studies evaluating the impact of stretching (typically after exercise) on delayed onset muscle soreness (DOMS).

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of stretching on muscle soreness

no.description: The literature suggests that stretching does not prevent muscle soreness

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that stretching probably doesn't prevent muscle soreness, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that stretching may prevent muscle soreness, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that stretching prevents muscle soreness

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of stretching on muscle soreness

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of stretching on muscle soreness, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of stretching on muscle soreness, but there are mixed results in specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that stretching might have an effect on muscle soreness, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that stretching may prevent muscle soreness, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that stretching may have a small effect on muscle soreness

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that stretching may prevent muscle soreness, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that stretching prevents muscle soreness
